result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney fees in the amount of $715.20 for Attorney Kevin Dague.

9:31 AM Defendant Austin M Anderson in court.  Attorney Kevin G. Dague in court for Austin M Anderson.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have an agreement. Defendant waives the right to have the Judge appear in person freely, knowingly and voluntarily and with the advice of counsel. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1: Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders: court costs and DNA sample and applicable surcharges. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in.
